title: Error in "Keeping up with releases"
body:
by **kenliz@cruzio.com**: 
There is a bug in the instructions for "Installing Go".

The final step in "Keeping up with releases" says:
make all

But it should say:

./all.bash

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. cd $GOROOT/src
2. hg pull
3. hg update release
4. make all

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

Expected build to proceed. Instead got message:
make: *** No rule to make target `all'.  Stop.

What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?

amd64 darwin

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)

0a2770db06ef release.2010-01-27/release

Please provide any additional information below.

Previous releases did not have this problem.
make all
worked O.K.
